post.description:
This API is used to start user registration by inputting phone number.
After this API is called, an OTP SMS will be sent to that number.

You can re-trigger this API to re-send OTP to the same phone number after 1 minute.

This OTP will expire in 10 minutes.
The SMS format will be:
```
[XFERS] Your OTP is 123456. This is to set up payments for `merchant_name` . If this is not done by you, please report to http://bit.ly/XfersSupport
```
This API uses a pair of public key and secret key.
The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`.
You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY`  to generate signature in the request body.

phone_no.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

signature.description: SHA1-hex of (phone_no + X-XFERS-APP_SECRET_KEY). More information on generating SHA1 here http://www.sha1-online.com/

get.summary: Get User API Token / Submit OTP
get.description:
After user receives the OTP SMS, merchant's app should capture the OTP and pass it to Xfers via this API.
This API will finish the registration and returns user_api_token. user_api_token is used to control the user's account.
You should save the user_api_token for future usage. (to be put in the `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY` in headers of other APIs)

It will also return a is_fully_verified if they already have an Xfers account and have completed our KYC process.

This API uses a pair of public key and secret key.
The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`. You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY` to generate signature in the request body.

parameters.name: otp
parameters.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

parameters.name: phone_no
parameters.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: SHA1-hex of (phone_no + OTP + APP_SECRET_KEY). More information on generating SHA1 here http://www.sha1-online.com/

parameters.name: return_url
parameters.description: Url that new user will be redirected after they completed Xfers account registration at `sign_up_url` provided.

put.description:
To provide KYC data in order to change user from unverified status into fully verified status.  

The image/document provided us must be hosted in a URL then pass the URL to Xfers via this API.  
Make sure data type for your image is jpeg / png.  
Maximum size of the image/ document is 10 MB.  

After this data is sent, we will do some verifications on our side and may take some time before user gets fully verified.  In Indonesia, fully verified user will be backed by a savings account.
Thus, there are required parameters which are mother_maiden_name, id_front_url, selfie_2id_url.
Additional data will speed up the KYC process.

id_front_url.description: URL storing the front image of user identity card

selfie_2id_url.description: URL storing the selfie of user holding their id card

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth for account holder in yyyy-mm-dd

identity_no.description: Account holder national identity number or, KTP number of Indonesian.

nric_type.description: Optional. Account holder's identity type. Allowable values: nric, fin, passport.

annual_income.description: Annual income of user in the local currency (SGD/IDR)

id_back_url.description: URL storing the back of the user id card

proof_of_address_url.description: URL storing the proof of address

support_document_1_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

support_document_2_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

support_document_3_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

support_document_4_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

support_document_5_url.description: URL storing the image/pdf of support documents like proof of user income

meta_data.description: Addtional data like Jumio info dump.

post.description:
Withdrawal Time varies upon country. 
For Indonesia, withdrawal time is instantaneous.
For Singapore, withdrawal time depends on whether it is an express withdrawal.

#### Withdrawal on Behalf
If you wish to withdraw to a bank account that does not belong to you, add in user_api_token in the params.

Behind the scenes, Xfers does a payout of funds from your Xfers account to that user’s Xfers account, followed by a withdrawal. This is required for compliance purposes as we cannot directly withdraw funds to a bank account that does not belong to you.

To clarify this:

Placing of xfers_api_token | Flow | Remark
--------------- |  ----------- | -----
merchant's token in header, user's token in body| merchant's Xfers account -> user's Xfers account -> user's bank Account | We call this `Withdrawal on Behalf`
user's token in header, nothing in body| user's Xfers account -> user's bank Account | This is the standard Withdrawal usage
merchant's token in header, nothing in body| merchant's Xfers account -> merchant's bank Account | This is usually done via Xfers Dashboard

post.description:
The following API will allow you to make a Direct Bank Transfer Payment request. Using Direct Bank Transfer has the advantage of having higher transaction limits as compared to normal Charge which uses your wallet balance (`/charges`). The API token used in `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY` header should be your customer's API token.
 
Merchants need to create a Direct Bank Transfer Payment request first. After receiving successful response from above API, please follow instruction in http://docs.xfers.io/Singapore#operation/getTransferInfo to get bank account details.
